intro: Ochrosia vieillardii, commonly known as the velvetleaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers with a distinctive, velvety texture. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and unique foliage. Ochrosia vieillardii thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun.
